{"step_by_step_thinking": "Bacteriocidal toxin, as the name suggests, is a substance that kills bacteria. It is not found in a zone of contamination, stimulation, or irritation. These zones refer to different stages or areas of wound healing or infection. The most logical place to find a bacteriocidal toxin would be in the zone of infection, where the body would be actively trying to kill off invading bacteria.", "answer_choice": "B"}
